title: The Golden Rule Can’t Abide Discrimination
sub_head: Strong religious convictions are intertwined with support for protections for LGBTQ Americans.
body:
As a former Republican congressman, a Christian and a member of the Conservatives Against Discrimination Leadership Council, I wish to respond to Margaret Harper McCarthy (“The Equality Act Is at War With Reality,” op-ed, March 31) by illustrating that strong religious convictions not only exist in tandem with support for nondiscrimination protections for LGBTQ Americans, but also that they are intertwined.
Church leaders and devout followers of Christ from all walks of life are helping to lead the charge in protecting the most vulnerable. From a young age, we were taught to treat others as you would like to be treated. It’s a tenet of the convictions we are called upon to live by.
A report from the Public Religion Research Institute in March found that large majorities of religious groups favor nondiscrimination laws to protect the LGBT community. This includes 82% of white mainline Protestants, 81% of Hispanic Catholics, 78% of Mormons, 77% of white Catholics, 73% of Black Protestants and 62% of white evangelical Protestants. I am encouraged that this sentiment is growing inside the GOP, too.
Congress has an opportunity to use this groundswell of support to achieve consensus on federal nondiscrimination protections. I encourage my former colleagues to work with religious leaders to honor the Golden Rule.
Steve Gunderson
